channel.title: And the world listened
channel.description:
This series presents dramatizations of famous speeches.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Demosthenes: Second Cheronese
item.description: Demosthenes - Second Cheronese. A strong plea for collective security, for halting aggression by a power whose aggressiveness may ultimately be turned against Athens.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Daniel Webster: Knapp murder trial
item.description: On Daniel Webster and the trial of Frank Knapp for the murder of Captain White of Salem.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Webster, Daniel, 1782-1852

item.title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt: Four freedoms
item.description: Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the Four Freedoms.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: U.S. History (1900-present)

item.title: Edmund Burke: Conciliation with America
item.description: A dramatization of Edmund Burke's speech asserting that taxation and representation are inseparably conjoined.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Winston Churchill: Battle of Britain
item.description: This program focuses on Winston Churchill and the protection of the home land and the survival of freedom.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: William Pitt: The attempt to subjugate America
item.description: William Pitt's speeches concern liberty, government by constitution, and the misery of war.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Pericles: Funeral address
item.description: Pericles - Funeral Address. This speech, akin to the Gettysburg Address, is the prototype of funeral addresses on national ceremonial occasions. Delivered at a critical moment in Athens' history.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Booker T. Washington: Atlanta International Exposition
item.description: Booker T. Washington and his speech at the Atlanta International Exposition.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Washington, Booker T., 1856-1915

item.title: Daniel O'Connell: Irish independence
item.description: More than a million people were said to have gathered at Tara in Ireland on Aug. 15, 1843, to hear Daniel O'Connell speak for Irish independence.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Abraham Lincoln: Lincoln-Douglas debate
item.description: This program focuses on Abraham Lincoln and his debated with Stephen Douglas.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc

item.title: Elizabeth Cady Stanton: Property rights
item.description: Elizabeth Cady Stanton and the fight for the right of women to hold property after marriage.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Women's rights

item.title: Cicero: First Philippic
item.description: Cicero - First Philippic. Concerned with the retention of the Republic and with the liberty and freedom of Roman citizens.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Speeches, addresses, etc

item.title: Peter Wentworth: Freedom of speech
item.description: Peter Wentworth's speech to the Commons in 1576 in the Parliament is the first extended discourse on freedom of speech. It earned him a stay in the Tower of London.
item.dc:creator: Stanley, J. Helen
item.dc:subject: Wentworth, Peter, approximately 1530-1596
